extensionDescription.message: Automatically groups and deduplicates tabs based on configurable rules.

domainTooltip.message: Enter domain (e.g., jira.com) or use *. for subdomains (e.g., *.jira.com).

regexTooltip.message: Select a preset or enter a RegEx. The 1st capturing group ( ) will be the group name.

dedupTooltip.message: 'Exact': Identical URL. 'Includes': New URL contained within an existing one.

presetNameTooltip.message: Name to identify this RegEx preset.

presetRegexTooltip.message: The Regular Expression (must contain one capturing group).

errorInvalidRegex.message: Invalid Regular Expression (must have capturing group ()).

errorPresetInUse.message: Cannot delete, this preset is in use.

domainFilterTooltip.message: Enter the domain (e.g., youtube.com) or a pattern (e.g., *google*). Rules apply to matching domains.

deduplicationModeTooltip.message: Exact Match: Tabs are duplicates if titles are identical. Includes Match: Tabs are duplicates if one title contains the other.

titleParsingRegExTooltip.message: Select a preset or write a custom regex to extract a part of the tab title for grouping or deduplication. The first capture group (text inside parentheses) is used.

urlParsingRegExTooltip.message: Regular expression to extract a value from the tab URL. The first capture group will be used.

groupNameSourceTooltip.message: Choose how the extension determines the group name.

labelTooltip.message: A unique name for this domain rule. This label will be used as the group title if the title parsing regex fails or is not set.

confirmDeleteGroup.message: Are you sure you want to delete the group '$groupName$'?

confirmDeleteGroupInUse.message: The group '$groupName$' is used by $ruleCount$ rule(s). Deleting it will remove these associations (rules will become ungrouped). Are you sure?

confirmDeleteGroupAssociated.message: The logical group "$1" is associated with $2 domain rule(s). Deleting this group will remove its association from these rules. Are you sure you want to delete it?
confirmDeleteGroupAssociated.description: Confirmation message when deleting a logical group that is associated with domain rules. $1 is the group label, $2 is the number of associated rules.

confirmDeleteGroupNoRules.message: Are you sure you want to delete the logical group "$1"? This group is not currently associated with any domain rules.
confirmDeleteGroupNoRules.description: Confirmation message when deleting a logical group that has no associated domain rules. $1 is the group label.

logicalGroupRuleTooltip.message: Assign this rule to a logical group.
